title: Fix badge in README
body: Something that has been bothering me, so let's gooo

title: Release 0.2.0
body: This enables the usage of the Todoist v2 REST API and unbreaks the tool.

title: Enable support for APIv2
body:
The Todoist REST API has switched and I finally found the time to actually
migrate this codebase off to v2 as well. The migration plan was as followed in
the todoist documentation (https://developer.todoist.com/rest/v2#migrating-from-v1), but as usual some things could have been potentially not correctly tested.

Even though not everything was tested, but at least listing and closing tasks
definitely works again, and that's like 90% of my workflow.

title: Update cargo deps
body: Updating the cargo deps since we haven't had these for a while.

title: Update main README with vhs usage gif
body:
I want to use something reusable, so VHS does the trick. Might need to adjust
still for future usage and add more gifs.

title: Update installation readme
body: Will soon work on some new packaging methods (homebrew/aur mostly)

title: Add test for project and label lists
Cleanup tests that use mocks for easier use
Add integration test for list expand
body: Test might be flaky? Need to investigate when I make a cleanup.

title: Refactor list test a bit and add task output test
Add tests for all variants of list
body: Starting to add some tests

title: Make list default for section command
body:
This concludes cleaning up of the command line. All commands can now be
expressed without the explicit list (though that one is still possible).

title: Make list default for the label command
body: Same as for projects.

title: Make list the default when passing projects with argument
body:
This makes the API a tad bit easier to use. Will do the same with all other
listables.

title: Make all aliases visible in help text
body: Makes it easier to read the help.

title: Add retries and backoffs
body:
- Add retries and backoffs to the gateway, should make it just a tad more
    resilient.
- Update cargo deps

title: Release 0.1.21
body:
This makes all interactive features that have been cooking for a while generally
available as a cargo install.

title: Add more custom filters to action menu
body:
Adds additional filters to the action menu. Tried cleaning it up a little, but
really don't want to go nightly. This is fine for now.

title: Allow to set filter on interactive task list
body:
Adds filtering on top of creating tasks in interactive mode actions. A bit
verbose but gets the job done. Will potentially clean up later.

title: Refactor task creation menu into submenu
body:
Will be able to put other items into this submenu, like picking a new filter.
For now business as usual with the existing task creation.

title: Interactive task code cleanup
body:
Just minor code cleanup, preparing a bit for a deeper action menu that allows
filters etc.

title: Create tasks in interactive list
body:
Add task creation in full interactive mode. This makes it close to the ideal
experience that I envisioned for this tool and marks it (almost) as feature
complete. It's become super useful finally and can be used as a daily driver
instead of the app.

title: Upgrade to clap 4
body:
Goes through the whole process of updating to the newest clap, and went through
all the deprecation warnings too.

title: Release 0.1.20
body:
Adds the various new interactive methods:
- Continuous list operation
- Interactive task creation

title: Full interactive section input
body:
Now in addition to interactive project input, section input is also fully
dynamic.

title: Implement project selection in interactive task creation
body:
This will allow to select a project during interactive task creation. Next up
should be section selection.

title: Add doist create for interactively creating a task
body: This implements a first pass of the interactive task creation menu. Using `doist A` it's now possible to start creating a task fully interactively. Will expand this a bit later to allow adding labels and projects/sections.

title: Implement continuous interactive mode
body:
It was always kind of annoying that after every single operation `doist` had to
be restarted. Now with `doist -i` it is possible to keep closing/editing tasks
until `ESC` is pressed, thus making it a bit closer to the main app experience.

title: Clean up errors so they're all consistently lowercase in gateway
body: This just aligns it with the rest of the code.

title: Release 0.1.19
body: Include all the recent changes, most notably NO_COLOR mode.

title: Document NO_COLOR usage
body:
Adds a little blurb to the README to indicate that NO_COLOR works as intended
when using the doist CLI.

title: Adjust coloring to disable it when requested
body:
Color will only show in terminals that support it and when the environment
variable NO_COLOR is not set. This will make the output properly pipable.

title: Add an integration test for listing
body:
This sets up a lot of code and files to finally use some integration tests to
show that the UI behaves as requested. These integration tests will still be
elaborated on but now there's a decent starting point.

This also fixed some of the extra unnecessary network calls that listing was making.

title: Add first phase of list integration test
body: Just wanted to get started with some initial tooling setup.

title: Add authentication integration test
body:
The first of many various integration tests, this checks if the authentication
is being correctly set up when doing `doist auth`.

title: Add ability to add labels when editing tasks
body:
This will allow to add labels when editing tasks through the edit command.
Should eventually make this possible through the task list, but that requires a
bit more TLC.

title: Release 0.1.18
body: Roll out all changes.

title: Fix doc
body: Fixed a cargo doc complaint

title: Enable subtask parent expansion
body:
It's a bit awkward when you see a task in the list without any further context
beside the project and labels. This adds an `--expand` parameter to the list
functionality to show the parents of the tasks that were part of the filter.

title: Move all extra display items to own module
body:
This was just slightly annoying to handle so just moving to separate file and
fixing docs.

title: Renamed the vague List to State for both Tasks and Projects
body:
This makes it a bit easier to read. In particular moved tasks::list::List to
tasks::state::State and renamed the projects::filter::List to
projects::state::State

title: Refactor interactive select
body:
I wanted to clean up all the various ways you can select interactively. Now
there should be only one way to do most of the interactive item selections
throughout the codebase. It's a bit ugly and involved, but this was the easiest
to avoid copy-pasta.

Additionally made subprojects to be shown in the project view, hah.

title: Add section creation and deletion
body:
Add possibilities to list sections in a project. This adds the right gateway
methods and the actual section creation and deletion.

I'm a bit unhappy about some of the inconsistencies that exist when providing
project and section names/ids and will focus on making a common filter/selection
API next. Otherwise sections are in, and soon you'll be able to edit tasks to
move them between sections, labels and projects.

title: Implement project creation and deletion
body:
This adds project creation and deletion commands. Allows to set the name and use
the interactive list when deleting.

title: Publish 0.1.17
body:
Publish 0.1.17 that includes the new label list, creation and deletion and a
critical fix for task lists filtering out their parent tasks.

title: Flatten the list if parent isn't in current filter
body:
If a parent task is not included in the current todoist filter, the app will
currently crash. This will essentially ignore the parents to ensure that the
list can still be reliably displayed without crashing, at the cost of not being
able to show the subtask relationship.

This is planned to improve by fetching _all_ tasks and then showing the subset
of tasks that were fetched via the filter, but that will come later.

Fixes #38

title: Show ID when selecting labels for deletion
body: Will do the full label list when interactively selecting labels.

title: Show labels with ID in list
body:
When listing all labels, also show the ID to allow it to be used for the -l
label ID.

title: Add label creation and deletion
body:
Added label creation and deletion. Did some refactoring here and there and
improved the label selection to just return pure labels, not even just IDs.

title: Add labels list command
body:
Lists available labels using `doist labels list`. Will build out so labels can
be created and deleted (if possible through the API), but at least they're now
visible.

title: Publish 0.1.16
Implement Project filter for `projects list`
body:
Adds a filter to `doist projects list` that then can be used to show how many
tasks a project has. If a project has 0 tasks, it is not displayed. Also added a
sneaky unit test.

Example usage is `doist projects list -f all`, but for example the regular list default of `doist projects list -f "(today | overdue)"` also works.

Fixes #25.

title: Publish 0.1.15
body: Makes list the default subcommand so `doist` already does something useful.

title: Make list the default command
body:
The list command has become incredibly versatile, so let's just make it the
default.

title: Publish 0.1.14
body: Publishes one part of #25

title: Make list more powerful with more filters
body:
Added the various project, section and label filters to list, so in addition to
the default todoist filters, you can use the `doist` provided fuzzy matching
filters to display the list accordingly.

Improves #25 partway.

title: Release 0.1.13
Fix undocumented colors crashing the app
body:
This allows colors to assume other numbers that were not entirely documented by
the Todoist documentation. I assume this is helpful for older projects, but will
make it also resilient for future updates. Added a small test to make sure this
case is fixed.

Fixes #24.

title: Implement last of the gateway unit tests
body:
This adds the last few gateway unit tests so I can be sure that the right calls
are being made when going through the gateway.

title: Add cargo fmt workflow
body: Add cargo formatting so Rust code is always properly formatted when checked in.

title: Add tests in gateway for projects
body:
Added more tests in gateway about projects, and finished up the task gateway
tests. Additionally made the task url type an actual url.

title: Add code of conduct
body: Add code of conduct from https://www.contributor-covenant.org/

title: Add authentication test
body: Add an authentication test and update some Cargo dependencies.

title: ALlow to create comments on tasks and projects
body:
Adds comment creation on projects and tasks. Additionally consolidated ID
handling on comments so it's either a task or a project and never both.

title: Implement project view
body:
Implements project view to display details of a project, including project
comments. Has interactive project selection just as with tasks if project is not
specified.

Has some refactoring here and there to keep code reuse to minimum, but probably needs another pass.

title: Enable viewing of task details with comments
body:
Implemented listing of comments and integrated them together with tasks so task
comments are now viewable. Additionally had some light cleanups around list.
Next up will probably be comment and detail view for projects.

title: Link address to Todoist settings
Release 0.1.12
Force dialoguer theme for active item so it doesn't break colors
body:
I noticed that when updating to the latest dialoguer with the active element
theme, it does break existing colors in the selected item. This way I get the
old behavior back while perhaps contemplating a patch for dialoguer to unbreak
this.

title: Show comment count on tasks and add full comment support
body:
- Implement comments and fetching of comments
    Not yet fully used, but will get there eventually.
- Move over rfc3339 parser where it should be
    This way I can use it throughout the API.
- Add associated type for Treeable
    Makes Treeable a bit nicer to use, since I also updated the IDs to u64s.

title: Extend README with new features and publish 0.1.11
body: Documented the new features and then bumped the cargo version for good measures.

title: Allow to add multiple labels when creating tasks.
body:
This adds the possibility to attach multiple labels when creating tasks via the
CLI. The fuzzy matching as with the other stuff applies, and it's possible to
attach multiple labels at once.

title: Allow to set sections when adding tasks.
body:
In addition to -P there will now also be -S which will select the section
instead of just the project. When a project is selected, then the section
selection will constrict itself to that project, but if used by itself with
enough uniqueness can assign even the project.

title: Add long and short params where applicable
body:
Due to some clap intricacies, the long name of a parameter is not set when
setting the short parameter name, so setting long parameter names explicitly for
the ones that need it.

Fixes #7.

title: Implement a fuzzy selector base for all API objects
Allow assigning projects with fuzzy search on task add
body: Now you can use `doist add "something" -P Project` to assign a task easily to a project

title: Fix closings of alternative shell commands
Fix typo
